meanings.definition: A limb of the body used for standing and walking.
meanings.sent1: My legge helps me walk to school every day.
meanings.sent2: She injured her legge while playing soccer.
meanings.sent3: The legge of the table wobbled comically as we tried to balance a stack of books on it.
meanings.sent4: The legge of the chair supported me like a sturdy pillar.
meanings.sent5: The legge of the bridge spanned the river majestically.

meanings.sent1: The shelf needed an extra legge to keep it from tipping over.
meanings.sent2: The tent was secured firmly with a strong legge on each corner.
meanings.sent3: The wobbly table legge was like a loyal friend, always there to lean on.
meanings.sent4: His encouragement was the legge that held her up during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The legge of the ladder provided stability as he climbed up to fix the roof.

meanings.definition: A branch or part of a forked object.
meanings.sent1: The legge of the tree reached out towards the sky.
meanings.sent2: She picked up the fallen legge of the broken rake.
meanings.sent3: The legge of the lightning bolt split the sky in a dazzling display.
meanings.sent4: The legge of the river forked into two smaller streams.
meanings.sent5: The legge of the road diverged, offering two different paths to explore.
